content: no man can't wait to watch this vid tell escapes to the Redman three buddies
tiles games the isometric terrain system craft them all while we go for a my
crafting friends today we're going to craft big ol buttresses oh no don't get
sick on me alright I'm talking about the architectural detail right okay got that
straight so we ran through these buttresses and they you know they're
great for castle walls but they're also could be nice for rooms too and I'll
show you that later on in the video so let's hit the table and I'll show you
how quick cheap and easy it is to make these buttress architectural details so
let's hit it
alright crafter let's get started so to start I picked up these Dollar
Tree foam blocks and there's 50 in a pack so that's really great and perfect
for this project these are really great too they take paint really well so I
guess I took one of the blocks and cut it in half don't worry about being too
perfect they're going to kind of squeeze up and then they'll they'll uh they'll
unscrews after a bit of time so give them a few minutes to unscrews it'll
kind of squeeze the block together when you cut it with the scissors and if it's
not perfect don't really worry about it so I want to do is I clued them together
so here's an example with the hot glue gun I've got two blocks on the bottom
then two more blocks on top of that then another block and then the two halves of
the piece I cut in half on top of those two okay so you can see the
configuration here and then I took a ballpoint pen and just kind of damaged
it right you can jab into it and draw across it you can also rip little pieces
off of it to do a little bit of battle damage or just age that kind of thing
now next I want to do a backing for this and I use matboard and this is
about three millimeters thick and I just did an inch inch wide strips the blocks
themselves are two thirds of an inch wide so I cut those and then what I did
was I hot glued it to the bottom of the buttress here and then I'm going to use
the scissors just to cut the end off right where it it matches up with the
end of the buttress and then I'll glue another piece on the back okay the same
way and now we'll let go to our table and paint these up just doing some
classic DM Scottie stone work here so I'm using my gray gray acrylic craft
paint put on fairly wet cover the whole deal over and on up
nice use loves to keep it off your hands then I use some burnt umber and some tan
and that gives some nice variation to the stone color right so it doesn't just
look like a even colored stone so just pop it on there while it's wet then I'm
going to put some wash on there black wash and then I'll give some more
details to this just wet black acrylic paint
let that dry up now let's try I'm going to add the gray back on there it got a
little dark on me there so I'll just add some gray back over it you can always
fix anything like that so got the varied colors underneath and then for the last
step I'll just add my highlight and it's a light gray I like to go along the
edges also a little bit in the middle too but along the edges and really pops
that detail out makes it really look like stone with the sponge there I just
trim up a sponge so it's a small little easily workable piece
put some highlights the top of the blocks there looking great here we are
at our table and you can see we have the castle wall set up from our last tile
scapes and we got Roderick and hilga they're trying to get in the gate still
trying to get in the gate and the buttresses came out really nice just
simple materials but a little bit of paint and they just look great I really
like the blocks that the counting blocks gave us some really just really nice and
there we go I think those came out great and they work great for the buttresses
of the castle walls but you can also use them on the interiors of tile scapes
right so here's a room and I have them in the interior and these make great
places to hide so we got Roderick and hilga and we got some archers hiding
behind the buttresses right and you can have them hold their action and when
they enter they can shoot I also got a Alchemist back there and a mage also
long range there and Roderick and he'll gonna have to figure out what they do so
they come up and attack the archers right you could have another enemy back
behind the buttress there with the archer and unspin those to them you know
they got another guard back there and I could make the combat really interesting
you can reveal it when they come up and then they push you know them back away
from the archer and the archer still can attack Oh where'd it go that don't don't
feel you're saving throw and fall over so yeah and then we still got the others
attached to and the archers so that can be pretty nasty so if they finish those
guys off they can go back to attacking the archers or they could try to attack
the others on the other side of the room say they attack the archers what I like
to do is well they kill them what I like to do is use the buttresses kind of
cover right and so that Roderick and Hilda could hide behind cover while the
others are you know shooting at them but also when you fight you can give a
little bit of give it a plus to cover bonus to somebody that's fighting around
an obstacle like that that way because people that the come SS static they've
been move around and that kind of thing and use it use the cover for their
advantage so that makes sense to stay near something like this right so that
the guards come out and fight you know try to hold them off they beat those
guys up a joke point there and they get in and finally get to beat up on those
The Alchemist and the mage so yeah I think those are
rate they really add a nice dynamic to the room as far as cover so there you go
I hope you like these buttresses oh wow
